definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to remain fresh in one's memory (idiom)
USB flash drive/see also 閃存盤|闪存盘[shan3 cun2 pan2]
pinyin: U S B ji4 yi4 bang4
kuai4 shan3 ji4 yi4 ti3 pan2
duan3 shi2 yu3 yin1 ji4 yi4
sui2 ji1 cun2 qu3 ji4 yi4 ti3

sentences.english: Their DNA was also loosening up and making memory genes more active.
sentences.chinese: 它們的DNA也鬆開了，使記憶體基因更加活躍。

sentences.english: This NNC is utilized by way of associative memory.
sentences.chinese: 網絡的使用利用聯想記憶法則。

sentences.english: In other words, it wreaks havoc on our memory.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，它對我們的記憶力造成了嚴重的破壞。

sentences.english: Time had wiped her image from my memory.
sentences.chinese: 時間把她的形象從我的記憶中抹去了。

sentences.english: If it is an umbrella, memory is the most clear coagulation red umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 倘若是打傘，記憶最深的是清凝的紅傘。

sentences.english: Could not allocate memory for a macro table.
sentences.chinese: 此巨集無法配置記憶體。

sentences.english: Is there any way I can improve my memory?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有什麼方法可以改善我的記憶力？

sentences.english: Is the sky in memory of Feiyan, flew over, they left off.
sentences.chinese: 記憶是天空中的飛雁，飛過，便留下過。

sentences.english: Memories of happier days were enshrined in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 以前快樂日子的記憶銘刻在我的心中。

sentences.english: Only one personality stands out in my memory.
sentences.chinese: 僅有一個人物聳立在我的記憶裏。

sentences.english: Although there are a lot of good time at that time, but also has a period of sadness long memory.
sentences.chinese: 那時雖有大把的好辰光，卻也有一段憂傷漫長的記憶。

sentences.english: The owners of these experiences recognize them as fragmentary semimemories.
sentences.chinese: 這些過往經歷的主人把它們當作是零碎的半記憶片段。

sentences.english: I jotted down stray thoughts and memories in the middle of the night.
sentences.chinese: 我將午夜無眠時零散的思緒和記憶隨手記下。

sentences.english: Lack of sleep can affect learning and memory.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏睡眠可以影響學習與記憶力。

sentences.english: This was a new pathway into the creation of memories that had never been understood before.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個進入了從未在以前的記憶理解創造新的途徑。

sentences.english: Psychologists could also identify the key ages that best allow for the memorization of classical texts.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家也可以幫助確定最適於記憶經典文本的年齡。

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
